name: Bengaluru
clues: Known as India's Silicon Valley for its tech industry
Home to Lalbagh Botanical Garden with a glasshouse
funFacts: Bengaluru is one of the highest-altitude major cities in India (900m above sea level).
The city has more than 1,000 software companies.

name: Chennai
clues: Marina Beach, the second-longest urban beach in the world
Capital of Tamil Nadu and a hub for classical music
funFacts: Chennai’s Kapaleeshwarar Temple is a masterpiece of Dravidian architecture.
The city is nicknamed the 'Detroit of India' for its automobile industry.

name: Hyderabad
clues: Famous for the historic Charminar monument
Birthplace of Hyderabadi biryani
funFacts: The Koh-i-Noor diamond was mined here and displayed at Golconda Fort.
Home to Ramoji Film City, the world’s largest film studio complex.

name: Kochi
clues: Port city with Chinese fishing nets
Gateway to Kerala's backwaters
funFacts: Kochi hosts the Kochi-Muziris Biennale, India’s largest art exhibition.
The Jewish Synagogue here is the oldest in the Commonwealth.

name: Mysuru
clues: Known as the 'City of Palaces' (e.g., Mysore Palace)
Famous for its Dasara festival
funFacts: Mysuru is India’s cleanest city, winning awards multiple times.
The city’s sandalwood oil is exported globally.

name: Thiruvananthapuram
clues: Capital of Kerala, near Kovalam Beach
Home to the Padmanabhaswamy Temple
funFacts: The temple’s underground vaults hold treasures worth billions.
India’s first IT park was established here in 1990.

name: Puducherry
clues: Former French colony with colonial architecture
Famous for Auroville (universal township)
funFacts: Puducherry has a French Quarter with streets named after French leaders.
The Sri Aurobindo Ashram attracts spiritual seekers worldwide.

name: Madurai
clues: Home to the Meenakshi Amman Temple with 33,000 sculptures
One of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in India
funFacts: The temple’s hall has 985 pillars, each uniquely carved.
Madurai is called the 'Athens of the East' for its cultural heritage.
